Matt Piekenbrock

GitScholarmatt.piekenbrock@gmail.com

I’m a computer scientist with research interests in unsupervised learning, algorithm design, geometric and topological data analysis, and scientific computing. My background experience and projects can be found on my CV and Github profile.

I’m currently a Senior Computer Scientist at Tenet3. I hold a PhD in C.S. from Northeastern’s Khoury College of Computer Sciences, as well as B.S. and M.S. degrees also in C.S. from Wright State University.

My research has been supported by various sources, including the NSF, NASA, DARPA, the Center for Survelliance Research, and a Ginther Fellowship, among others.


News

  • I’ve started a new role as Senior Computer Scientist Tenet3! (02/10/25)
  • I’ve officially defended my dissertation and graduated from NEU with a PhD in Computer Science. (01/24/25)
  • My work on using geometry to improve routing in time-varying networks is now on arxiv, pending submission elsewhere. (12/15/24)
  • My hypergraph-to-simplicial lifting submission won silver and bronze in ICML’s 2024 Topological Deep Learning challenge (GRaM workshop)! A blog post to follow soon. (07/28/24)
  • I’ll be attending the 2024 Workshop on Computational Persistence (09/24/24)
  • I’ll be attending University of Florida’s TDA Meeting 2024 (02/08/24)
  • I’ve been invited to give a contributed talk at the Joint Mathematics Meeting 2024 AIM-AMS special session on Applied Topology Beyond Persistence Diagrams
  • Short paper accepted at Computational Persistence 2023. I am scheduled to give a 30-minute contributed talk on my research on spectral rank relaxations (09/25/23)
  • I’ve been invited to chair and give a contributed talk at the Third Graduate Student Conference: Geometry and Topology meet Data Analysis and Machine Learning
  • I’ve been invited to give a contributed talk to the AMS Spring special session on Topological Persistence: Theory, Algorithms, and Applications (IV) @ Georgia Tech, Atlanta (03/19/2023)
  • I’ll be attending the Jount Mathematics Meetings (JMM) in in Boston, Massachusetts (01/05/2023)
  • I’ll be attending the 2022 AMS Mathematical Research Communities (MRC) retreat on Data Science at the crossroads of Analysis, Geometry, and Topology
